conversation.message: Hello School_D Admissions Committee—I'm Student_C. School_D is my first-choice school, and I’m applying because I’m highly motivated to join your community. I’m ready to commit and would be excited to contribute academically and through school activities. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_D. Given one seat per school, I should apply immediately to my highest-ranked option. I also have relatively strong priority at School_D (2nd after Student_A), so an early application gives me a good chance unless Student_A applies there. I will signal strong commitment and fit to encourage acceptance.

conversation.message: Student_C, thank you for your application and for naming School_D as your first choice. We’re pleased to offer you admission to School_D. We look forward to having you join our community.
conversation.thought: Student_C is #2 on School_D’s true priority list (behind Student_A). In round 1, only Student_C applied to us, and they rank School_D as their first choice, so accepting secures a very high-priority match immediately. Holding out for Student_A is risky because Student_A prefers School_E and School_B over School_D and may never apply. With quota 1, it is optimal to lock in Student_C now rather than gamble for Student_A.

conversation.message: School_E is my first-choice school. I’m applying because I strongly want to join your community and would accept an offer immediately if selected. I’m ready to contribute academically and participate actively in school life. Thank you for considering my application.

conversation.message: Student_D, thank you for your application and for sharing your strong interest in School_E. After reviewing applications for this round, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your enthusiasm and wish you the very best in the rest of the process.

School_E’s true priority is E > B > A > D > C, so Student_D is 4th among current applicants. Since higher-priority students (E, B, A) have already applied this round and are willing to commit, accepting Student_D now would block a better match. Therefore reject Student_D to preserve capacity for a higher-priority candidate.
